descriptions.en: A consolidated view of the learning outcomes covered by labs 1 and 2, with a breakdown into suboutcomes.
Products, architecture, roles, and collaboration workflows.

coverage_notes.en: The lab tasks map directly to the stated learning outcomes: architecture description + diagram, roles/skills mapping, and practicing GitHub workflow with peer review.

titles.en: Explain the basic architecture of a real-world digital product

descriptions.en: Explain modules, data flow, and deployment of a real-world digital product using both text and a diagram.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the architecture description and diagram tasks; students must be able to explain their diagram during review.

descriptions.en: Break the product into major modules (clients, services, data stores) and describe what each does.
Explain how modules communicate for a typical user action and what data moves between them.

titles.en: Explain deployment at a high level

descriptions.en: Describe where components live (device/server/cloud) and how the system is deployed conceptually.
List assumptions and questions about parts of the architecture you are not fully sure about.
Create a diagram showing modules and data flow clearly enough to explain it to another engineer.

titles.en: Identify roles and shared skills across the product

descriptions.en: Identify which tech roles work on which parts of the product and which general skills are shared across roles.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the roles/skills mapping task, which explicitly requires roadmap.sh and job postings research.

descriptions.en: For each module, list the likely roles involved (e.g., backend, frontend/mobile, DevOps, QA, PM).
List common skills that appear across roles (Git, Linux basics, HTTP, communication, etc.).
Pick a role and reflect on skills you have and skills you lack using roadmap.sh.
Review 2–3 job postings and summarize which skills repeatedly appear and which ones are surprising.

titles.en: Use GitHub issues, branches, and pull requests

descriptions.en: Use issues, branches, and pull requests to structure work and get peer review.

coverage_notes.en: Covered throughout the lab: each task is tracked via issues/PRs, and peer review is explicitly required.

titles.en: Track work with issues and branches

descriptions.en: Create task issues, work on dedicated branches, and keep changes reviewable.
Request reviews, leave meaningful feedback, address comments, and merge when approved.

titles.en: Reflect on role choice and skill growth

descriptions.en: Write a short reflection about the chosen role, architectural insights, and concrete skills to improve.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the reflection task, which is explicitly personal and should not be written by an LLM.

descriptions.en: Identify a small set of skills to improve this semester and explain why they matter for the chosen role.
Local backend development, bug fixing, testing, and deployment to a Linux VPS.

coverage_notes.en: The tasks cover all stated outcomes: local run/debug work, bug documentation + fix, small feature, and end-to-end deployment with systemd and Nginx.

titles.en: Run and modify a backend service locally

descriptions.en: Set up a Python environment, run a FastAPI app locally, and make changes confidently with tests.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the local development tasks (run locally, implement changes, and add/update tests).

descriptions.en: Create and use a virtual environment and install dependencies from `requirements.txt`.
Start Uvicorn with reload and verify health/status endpoints.
Add or update a small test to prevent regressions when fixing bugs or implementing features.

titles.en: Document and fix a bug using a structured process

descriptions.en: Write a clear bug report, reproduce the issue, implement a fix, and validate it with a test and review.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the explicit bug documentation task and the follow-up fix task with tests + PR review.

descriptions.en: Describe expected vs actual behavior, include repro steps, and attach relevant logs/screenshots.
Fix the bug on a branch, open a PR, request review, and merge after feedback is addressed.

titles.en: Apply a Git workflow (issues → branches → PRs → review)

descriptions.en: Use task/bug issues and PRs to track work, request review, and merge changes cleanly.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by both the bug-fix and feature work, each requiring its own issue and PR.

descriptions.en: Reference and close issues from PR descriptions and keep the work traceable.

titles.en: Deploy a Python backend to a Linux VPS

descriptions.en: Deploy a FastAPI service using SSH, virtual environments, systemd for process management, and Nginx as a reverse proxy.

coverage_notes.en: Covered by the deployment part of the lab; each step (SSH, venv, systemd, Nginx) has a dedicated task and TA check.

descriptions.en: Connect to the server, navigate the filesystem, and run commands in a remote environment.
Create a systemd unit, enable it on boot, and inspect logs/status when debugging.
Configure Nginx as a reverse proxy and verify the app is reachable externally.
Confirm the service is running and reachable from your browser (or curl) via the server IP/domain and Nginx.
